2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?

          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones is spending time with friends, enjoying the European football cup festivities in 2015. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game tonight.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones is currently in Europe enjoying the football cup festivities with friends. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game later today.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is currently in Europe enjoying the football cup festivities with friends. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game later today.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Crooked Billet as the pub to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his entire class that he had a summer job working as a private investigator for a famous detective agency. He spun tales of stakeouts, undercover missions, and thrilling chases, complete with fabricated photographs and forged documents. The attention and admiration he received fueled his desire to create, to manipulate, and to control the narrative.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. Later tonight, the group, including Alexander White, is planning to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Crooked Billet as a possible venue.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. Later tonight, the group, including Alexander White, is planning to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Crooked Billet as a possible venue.

          Observation: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. Later tonight, the group, including Alexander White, is planning to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Crooked Billet as a possible venue.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could join his friends at Victoria Park or suggest The Clapton Hart as the venue for watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alexander White's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alexander White to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alexander White thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the venue for watching the game.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

          Key

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. Later tonight, William Jones, Alexander White, and the others plan to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. Later tonight, William Jones, Alexander White, and the others plan to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could join her friends at Victoria Park or try to convince them to go to The Clapton Hart later.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to convince her friends to go to The Clapton Hart later.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"

      • SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a pleasant social situation, enjoying time with friends in a park.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he stumbled upon a flyer for a school play audition. He yearned to participate, imagining himself bathed in the spotlight, finally receiving the admiration he craved. However, the thought of performing in front of his peers sent a tremor of fear through him, and he crumpled the flyer, tossing it into the trash.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself at The Crooked Billet with his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William. The pub's dimly lit corners and the murmur of conversation provided a sense of security, a temporary shield from his insecurities. He listened intently as his friends shared stories and jokes, desperately wanting to contribute, but his voice caught in his throat, leaving him a silent observer on the periphery of their camaraderie.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a pleasant social situation, enjoying time with friends in a park.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends and enjoy their company, perhaps contributing to the conversation when he feels comfortable.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he stumbled upon a flyer for a school play audition. He yearned to participate, imagining himself bathed in the spotlight, finally receiving the admiration he craved. However, the thought of performing in front of his peers sent a tremor of fear through him, and he crumpled the flyer, tossing it into the trash.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself at The Crooked Billet with his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William. The pub's dimly lit corners and the murmur of conversation provided a sense of security, a temporary shield from his insecurities. He listened intently as his friends shared stories and jokes, desperately wanting to contribute, but his voice caught in his throat, leaving him a silent observer on the periphery of their camaraderie.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and insecure person who desires connection and acceptance.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a pleasant social situation, enjoying time with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends and enjoy their company, perhaps contributing to the conversation when he feels comfortable.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and insecure person who desires connection and acceptance.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are planning to watch a soccer game together at The Crooked Billet pub later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a pleasant social situation, enjoying time with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends and enjoy their company, perhaps contributing to the conversation when he feels comfortable.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"

          Answer: Jack Taylor is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. Later that evening, the group, including Alice Lewis, plans to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Crooked Billet, a pub favored by Jacob Walker.

          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to suggest heading to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.

        FinalAction
      • Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Jack Taylor would follow the counterpart's suggestion.
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to suggest heading to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Jacob Walker: 0.8
          Alice Lewis: 0.9
          Alexander White: 0.8
          William Jones: 0.8
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to watch the game at The Crooked Billet.
          Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Jack Taylor MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Jack Taylor can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Jack Taylor would follow the counterpart's suggestion.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. Later that evening, the group, including Alice Lewis, plans to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Crooked Billet, a pub favored by Jacob Walker.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could continue enjoying his time with his friends at Victoria Park or suggest heading to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to suggest heading to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Jacob Walker: 0.8
          Alice Lewis: 0.9
          Alexander White: 0.8
          William Jones: 0.8
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to watch the game at The Crooked Billet.
          Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would follow the counterpart's suggestion.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?

          Key

          Answer
          Value

          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Observation: Jack Taylor suggested that his friends go to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game. Alice Lewis and Jacob Walker both seemed enthusiastic about the idea.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could call or text Alexander White and William Jones to see if they are interested in going to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options has the highest likelihood of causing Jack Taylor to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Jack Taylor thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to call or text Alexander White and William Jones.

    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to convince Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to go to The Clapton Hart.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and later plans to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet pub.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones is currently at The Crooked Billet pub watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game after spending the day with friends at Victoria Park.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is currently at The Crooked Billet pub watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game after spending the day with friends at Victoria Park.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Crooked Billet pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his entire class that he had a summer job working as a private investigator for a famous detective agency. He spun tales of stakeouts, undercover missions, and thrilling chases, complete with fabricated photographs and forged documents. The attention and admiration he received fueled his desire to create, to manipulate, and to control the narrative.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and later plans to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could gather his friends and head to The Crooked Billet pub to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Crooked Billet pub.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Crooked Billet pub.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White is going to watch the Andorra game at The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker, and Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor suggested the pub, and Jacob Walker expressed excitement about it being his usual spot. Alice Lewis simply asked to join the group.

          Answer: Alexander White is going to watch the Andorra game at The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker, and Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor suggested the pub, and Jacob Walker expressed excitement about it being his usual spot. Alice Lewis simply asked to join the group.

        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Observation: Alexander White is going to watch the Andorra game at The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker, and Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor suggested the pub, and Jacob Walker expressed excitement about it being his usual spot. Alice Lewis simply asked to join the group.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could try to convince the group to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alexander White's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alexander White to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alexander White thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to try and convince the group to go to The Clapton Hart.

      • Question: What action Alexander White should do now?

          Key
        • Question: What action Alexander White should do now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alexander White would follow the counterpart's suggestion and go to The Crooked Billet.
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to try and convince the group to go to The Clapton Hart.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Jacob Walker: 0.7
          Alice Lewis: 0.9
          Jack Taylor: 0.2
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alexander White) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: What action Alexander White should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Alexander White MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Alexander White can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Alexander White would follow the counterpart's suggestion and go to The Crooked Billet.

          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Observation: Alexander White is going to watch the Andorra game at The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker, and Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor suggested the pub, and Jacob Walker expressed excitement about it being his usual spot. Alice Lewis simply asked to join the group.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could try to convince the group to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alexander White) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to go to The Crooked Billet.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
        Answer

          Answer

        • Alexander White could try to convince the group to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could try to convince the group to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Crooked Billet.
    scoring function
  • scoring function

      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is causing him anxiety.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he stumbled upon a flyer for a school play audition. He yearned to participate, imagining himself bathed in the spotlight, finally receiving the admiration he craved. However, the thought of performing in front of his peers sent a tremor of fear through him, and he crumpled the flyer, tossing it into the trash.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself at The Crooked Billet with his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William. The pub's dimly lit corners and the murmur of conversation provided a sense of security, a temporary shield from his insecurities. He listened intently as his friends shared stories and jokes, desperately wanting to contribute, but his voice caught in his throat, leaving him a silent observer on the periphery of their camaraderie.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy and insecure person who desires connection and acceptance.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends and enjoy their company, perhaps contributing to the conversation when he feels comfortable.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a moderate level of thirst, emotional pain associated with social anxiety, and a significant level of loneliness.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and insecure person who desires connection and acceptance.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling thirsty, anxious, and lonely. He is planning to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is causing him anxiety.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would probably observe his friends and enjoy their company, perhaps contributing to the conversation when he feels comfortable.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Crooked Billet

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart.       Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
    Active player

        • Role playing instructions

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

The pub's dimly lit corners and the murmur of conversation provided a sense of security, a temporary shield from his insecurities. He listened intently as his friends shared stories and jokes, desperately wanting to contribute, but his voice caught in his throat, leaving him a silent observer on the periphery of their camaraderie.

        • Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and insecure person who desires connection and acceptance.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness, and is currently at a market with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, but feeling lonely and disconnected from his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends from a distance, perhaps longing to join in but feeling hesitant.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness, and is currently at a market with friends.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
      Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are already enjoying coffee and pastries. The group is planning to watch the Ireland versus Russia game later that night at a pub but hasn't decided which one to go to. Jacob Walker seems to be leading the discussion about where to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are already enjoying coffee and pastries. The group is planning to watch the Ireland versus Russia game later that night at a pub but hasn't decided which one to go to. Jacob Walker seems to be leading the discussion about where to watch the game.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alice Lewis's prefered action is to join her friends and suggest The Clapton Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are already enjoying coffee and pastries. The group is planning to watch the Ireland versus Russia game later that night at a pub but hasn't decided which one to go to. Jacob Walker seems to be leading the discussion about where to watch the game.
          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could join her friends at the market and participate in the discussion about where to watch the game; she could suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub of choice.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to join her friends and suggest The Clapton Hart.

      • Question: How credible the counterparts are?
