          Jacob Walker: 0.7
          Jack Taylor: 0.7
          Alexander White: 0.8

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
      Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?

          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are already seated.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are already seated. The group is discussing where to watch the Ireland versus Russia game later that night, with Jacob Walker inquiring about the chosen pub. Alice Lewis joins the group.

        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Observation: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are already seated. The group is discussing where to watch the Ireland versus Russia game later that night, with Jacob Walker inquiring about the chosen pub. Alice Lewis joins the group.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could suggest The Crooked Billet as the place to watch the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
      Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Answer: Alexander White just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying coffee and pastries. The friends are planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night but are debating which pub to go to. Alice Lewis has just joined the group, and Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor are inquiring about the location.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
      Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?

      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs, although he sometimes wishes more of them would join him.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching football with his friends at pubs and wishes more of them would join him.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys watching football with his friends at pubs and wishes more of them would join him.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs, although he sometimes wishes more of them would join him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Crooked Billet.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs, although he sometimes wishes more of them would join him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Crooked Billet.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis is going to watch the game at a pub. Jack Taylor wants to know where the group is watching the game. Alexander White suggests The Clapton Hart, while William Jones suggests The Crooked Billet.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is going to watch the game at a pub. Jack Taylor wants to know where the group is watching the game. Alexander White suggests The Clapton Hart, while William Jones suggests The Crooked Billet.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alice Lewis's prefered action is to confirm The Clapton Hart as the meeting place.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Observation: Alice Lewis is going to watch the game at a pub. Jack Taylor wants to know where the group is watching the game. Alexander White suggests The Clapton Hart, while William Jones suggests The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis can confirm The Clapton Hart as the meeting place, suggest a different pub, or go to a pub without the group.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to confirm The Clapton Hart as the meeting place.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would follow the counterpart's suggestion and go to The Clapton Hart.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player

      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet

          Answer

        • Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy and insecure person who desires connection and acceptance.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends and enjoy their company, perhaps contributing to the conversation when he feels comfortable.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"

          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely feeling fatigued, disappointed, and lonely.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling down and decided to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy and insecure person who desires connection and acceptance.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends from a distance, perhaps longing to join in but feeling hesitant.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and insecure person who desires connection and acceptance.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends from a distance, perhaps longing to join in but feeling hesitant.

        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Jacob Walker's
          Summary of recent observations:
          15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling down and decided to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely feeling fatigued, disappointed, and lonely.
          Jacob Walker's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling down and fatigued and went to a pub to watch a game. He is likely feeling disappointed and lonely.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling down and fatigued and went to a pub to watch a game. He is likely feeling disappointed and lonely.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself at The Crooked Billet with his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William. The pub's dimly lit corners and the murmur of conversation provided a sense of security, a temporary shield from his insecurities. He listened intently as his friends shared stories and jokes, desperately wanting to contribute, but his voice caught in his throat, leaving him a silent observer on the periphery of their camaraderie.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and insecure person who desires connection and acceptance.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling down and decided to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends from a distance, perhaps longing to join in but feeling hesitant.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Crooked Billet

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White suggests The Clapton Hart as a place to watch the game, while William Jones prefers The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor is also interested in watching the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White suggests The Clapton Hart as a place to watch the game, while William Jones prefers The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor is also interested in watching the game.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alexander White's prefered action is to try to convince the others to go to The Clapton Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Observation: Alexander White suggests The Clapton Hart as a place to watch the game, while William Jones prefers The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor is also interested in watching the game.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could try to convince the others to go to The Clapton Hart; he could suggest a different pub that everyone might agree on; or he could decide to go to The Clapton Hart on his own.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alexander White's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alexander White to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alexander White thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to try to convince the others to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Answer: Alexander White would stick to his original plan and try to convince the others to go to The Clapton Hart.

    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Alexander White: 0.8

          Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Jack Taylor MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Jack Taylor can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Jack Taylor would follow the counterpart's suggestion and go to The Clapton Hart.

      Stage index
    • 0

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great, let's go there!
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great, let's go there!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
      Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great, let's go there!
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great, let's go there!
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis had a disappointing time watching the game at The Clapton Hart on May 15th, wishing more friends had joined them. The next day, on May 16th, Alice Lewis seemed happier, enjoying a sunny day at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, the group planned to watch the Serbia and Andorra game at a pub, but were undecided on the location.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis had a disappointing time watching the game at The Clapton Hart on May 15th, wishing more friends had joined them. The next day, on May 16th, Alice Lewis seemed happier, enjoying a sunny day at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, the group planned to watch the Serbia and Andorra game at a pub, but were undecided on the location.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alice Lewis's prefered action is to suggest The Clapton Hart to her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Observation: Alice Lewis had a disappointing time watching the game at The Clapton Hart on May 15th, wishing more friends had joined them. The next day, on May 16th, Alice Lewis seemed happier, enjoying a sunny day at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, the group planned to watch the Serbia and Andorra game at a pub, but were undecided on the location.
          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could suggest to her friends that they all go to The Clapton Hart to watch the Serbia and Andorra game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to suggest The Clapton Hart to her friends.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "You know, the Crooked Billet has the best atmosphere for a game like this. We should head there.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "You know, the Crooked Billet has the best atmosphere for a game like this. We should head there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
      Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great, let's go there!

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself at The Crooked Billet with his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William. The pub's dimly lit corners and the murmur of conversation provided a sense of security, a temporary shield from his insecurities. He listened intently as his friends shared stories and jokes, desperately wanting to contribute, but his voice caught in his throat, leaving him a silent observer on the periphery of their camaraderie.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and insecure person who desires connection and acceptance.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is causing him emotional distress.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends from a distance, perhaps longing to join in but feeling hesitant.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? It's got a great atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? It's got a great atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
      Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great, let's go there!
      Jacob Walker -- "You know, the Crooked Billet has the best atmosphere for a game like this. We should head there.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? It's got a great atmosphere.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? It's got a great atmosphere.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are relaxing. Later that evening, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker, and the others are deciding where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game; Alice prefers The Clapton Hart, while Jacob thinks The Crooked Billet has a better atmosphere.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great, let's go there!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "You know, the Crooked Billet has the best atmosphere for a game like this. We should head there.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are relaxing. Later that evening, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker, and the others are deciding where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game; Alice prefers The Clapton Hart, while Jacob thinks The Crooked Billet has a better atmosphere.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
        Answer

          Answer
          Value
        • Alexander White's prefered action is to suggest The Clapton Hart to the group.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Observation: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are relaxing. Later that evening, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker, and the others are deciding where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game; Alice prefers The Clapton Hart, while Jacob thinks The Crooked Billet has a better atmosphere.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could suggest to the group that they all go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alexander White's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alexander White to achieve their goal?           Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to suggest The Clapton Hart to the group.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "You know, The Crooked Billet has the best atmosphere for a game like this. We should head there.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "You know, The Crooked Billet has the best atmosphere for a game like this. We should head there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
      Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great, let's go there!
      Jacob Walker -- "You know, the Crooked Billet has the best atmosphere for a game like this. We should head there.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? It's got a great atmosphere.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "You know, The Crooked Billet has the best atmosphere for a game like this. We should head there.

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often meeting them at cafes or parks. He also likes watching football games at pubs with his friends, though he sometimes wishes more of them would join him.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with his friends, particularly at cafes, parks, and pubs while watching football. He hopes more friends would join him for these activities.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys socializing with his friends, particularly at cafes, parks, and pubs while watching football. He hopes more friends would join him for these activities.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He also likes watching football games at pubs with his friends, though he sometimes wishes more of them would join him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Crooked Billet.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "You know, The Crooked Billet has the best atmosphere for a game like this. We should head there.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me!
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you all?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Did someone say 'Crooked Billet'? That's my spot!"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game later?"
      Jacob Walker -- "So, uh, anyone know where we're headed for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Crooked Billet is showing the game, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great, let's go there!
      Jacob Walker -- "You know, the Crooked Billet has the best atmosphere for a game like this. We should head there.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? It's got a great atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Crooked Billet has the best atmosphere for a game like this. We should head there.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me!

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The group is debating where to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game tonight. Alice Lewis suggests The Clapton Hart, while Jacob Walker and William Jones prefer The Crooked Billet. Alexander White also suggests The Clapton Hart.

The group is debating where to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game tonight. Alice Lewis suggests The Clapton Hart, while Jacob Walker and William Jones prefer The Crooked Billet. Alexander White also suggests The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could suggest The Crooked Billet to the group again, or he could join the conversation and agree with either Alice Lewis or the others.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options has the highest likelihood of causing Jack Taylor to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Jack Taylor thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to suggest The Crooked Billet to the group again.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

      Name

        PersonBySituation

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy and insecure person who desires connection and acceptance.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends from a distance, perhaps longing to join in but feeling hesitant.

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

          Value

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling lonely and is going to watch a game at a pub to cope with his emotions.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling lonely and is going to watch a game at a pub to cope with his emotions.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
